channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Southeast Asia’s ‘incredibly dynamic’ Islamic finance market is drawing in non-Islamic players
item.description: Mambu, an Amsterdam based, SaaS firm is banking on the region's younger people gravitating towards financial solutions that adhere to Islamic principl...

item.title: How Target let Walmart steal its rizz
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Beyond snubbing Tinder, Bumble, and casual flings, more than half of Gen Z is spending $0 monthly on dating, BofA finds
item.description: Gen Z’s economic anxiety—as well as disinterest in casual dating—has led many young people to spend little to nothing on dates.

item.title: Starbucks’ CEO is ditching a merit system and giving all salaried staff a flat 2% pay raise instead
item.description: The coffee chain cited limiting costs during a turnaround effort as it’s reason for the modest pay bump.

item.title: This Gen Zer washed his college basketball team’s dirty clothes to prove his passion—now he’s one of the youngest interns ever at the NBA
item.description: Mocked as ‘mop boy,’ Daniel Sung turned a year of college basketball grunt work into a dream NBA internship, LinkedIn fame, and multiple startup offer...
